Project Name
Client
Brief Description
Services
Market Outlook Analysis
Temporary Staffing Company
Estimated the size and growth prospect for 
market segments catered by the client. 
Identified the top geographical areas to 
expand business, with highest market size, 
growth outlook and low market share.
▪Market Sizing analysis 
SUCCESS STORIES - SUMMARY
1

MARKET OUTLOOK ANALYSIS FOR TEMPORARY STAFFING COMPANY
SITUATION
▪Client needed an in-depth understanding of the U.S. temporary staffing market to define a more targeted approach for formulating growth 
strategies for the business
▪Merilytics partnered with the client to assess the temporary staffing market and its growth outlook in the U.S. coupling it with their existing 
presence to identify areas of opportunity to initiate/expand branch presence
▪Developed a robust analytical model to estimate the temporary staffing market size by leveraging employment and wage data from various U.S. 
employment related data sources such as Economic Modeling Specialists Intl. (EMSI), Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS), Occupation Employment 
Statistics (OES) etc. 
▪Estimated Market size and corresponding growth projections for all the U.S. counties at overall level and by target industry segments (including 
Manufacturing, Logistics, Clerical and Transportation) to identify the low hanging fruits where the company should initiate/expand presence
VALUE ADDITION
IMPACT
▪The analyses provided the client visibility into which counties they should focus on to improve their market share and which counties to initiate 
presence in, given the significant size and positive growth aspects
ABOUT THE CLIENT
Client is one of the largest industrial staffing companies in the U.S. catering to manufacturing, logistics, clerical and transportation segments
2

METHODOLOGY/ APPROACH
3
01 
02 
03 
04 
Market size is then estimated based on temporary employment for the segment, median hourly wages, average working hours and 
average mark-up %
Present market share is estimated basis the annual revenues and the estimated market sizes
Extracted the employment and wage information for each identified North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) and 
occupation code by county
Aggregated the extracted numbers and applied a job share to arrive at an estimated count of temporary employment relevant to 
the industry vertical
Identified the NAICS and occupation codes most relevant to the industry vertical ensuring the selection is inline with the client’s 
target market
Overlaid the market share information on the market size analysis to identify opportunities to grow

LEARNINGS
8
•
Improved understanding of the U.S. labor market data and temporary staffing industry
•
Working on EMSI interface and data pull procedures 
•
Segmentation of data by industries using NAICS, SOC (Security Operation Center) and WC (Workers' compensation) codes for 
various datasets.
•
Improved understanding of the factors impacting the growth of job market in US.
•
Improved and automated procedures data cleanup, manipulation, aggregation and visualization using VBA and PowerBI.
